Dialogue.Page: Hey, it's me, Ernesto the magic talking anglerfish.
I got very old. This is what happens to people when they get very old. Didn't you know that?

DialogueOption.Text: Yes, of course. This museum has been very enriching.
No, I didn't. Can you tell me where everyone's gone?

Dialogue.Page: I'm glad you're enjoying it. Be sure to check out my pieces of modern art along the south wall.
The one on the left is titled "Take the Jam money and run," while the one on the right is "Take the Jam money and run (1)."
They're subversive masterpieces, if I do say so myself.

DialogueOption.Text: Yeah, could you tell me where everyone's gone?

Dialogue.Page: It's a telescope. I evolved it when I took on the job of museum curator. Nowadays it's my only source of vision.
Anyway, you look a bit out of sorts... Do you need any help?
Nah, just kidding. Your guess is as good as mine, kid.
If you're searching for answers, though, I might start by heading to the Quantum Grove. It'll clue you in.

DialogueOption.Text: Thank you, Ernesto. I'll be going then.
